Base Styles

Introduction

Base Styles provides a set of base styles for you to extend upon.

Block Text Elements

Headers

<h1>Header

The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.

<h2>Header

The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.

<h3>Header

The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.

<h4>Header

The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.

<h5>Header

The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.

<h6>Header

The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.

Other block text elements

<p> Paragraph

The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.

<pre> Preformatted

The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.

<blockquote> Blockquote

The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.

<figure>Figure

<figcaption> Figcaption

Inline Text Elements

Markup Rendering
<a> Link
<a class="is-a-hover"> Link, hover state
<a class="is-a-active"> Link, active state
<a class="is-a-visited"> Link, visited state
<em> Emphasized text
<strong> Important text
<small> Side comment
<s> Irrelevant or inaccurate text
<cite> Citation
<q> Inline quotation
<quote> Quotation
<dfn> Represents a term whose definition is contained in its nearest ancestor content.
<abbr> Abbreviation or an acronym
<time> Date and/or Time
<code> Code
<var> Variable
<samp> Output
<kbd> Input
<sub> Subscript
<sup> Superscript
<i> Alternate mood
<b> Unimportant emphasized text
<u> Annotation
<mark> Highlighted text
<ins> Insertion
<del> del
<math> del
